ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Fast and easily computes an Euclidean Minimum Spanning Tree (EMST) from data, relying on the R API for 'mlpack' - the C++ Machine Learning Library (Curtin et. al., 2013). 'emstreeR' uses the Dual-Tree Boruvka (March, Ram, Gray, 2010, <doi:10.1145/1835804.1835882>), which is theoretically and empirically the fastest algorithm for computing an EMST. This package also provides functions and an S3 method for readily plotting Minimum Spanning Trees (MST) using either the style of the 'base', 'scatterplot3d', or 'ggplot2' libraries.

Fast and easily computes an Euclidean Minimum Spanning Tree (EMST) from data, relying on the R API for 'mlpack' - the C++ Machine Learning Library (Curtin et. al., 2013). 'emstreeR' uses the Dual-Tree Boruvka (March, Ram, Gray, 2010, <doi:10.1145/1835804.1835882>), which is theoretically and empirically the fastest algorithm for computing an EMST. This package also provides functions and an S3 method for readily plotting Minimum Spanning Trees (MST) using either the style of the 'base', 'scatterplot3d', or 'ggplot2' libraries.

name: r-emstreer
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "3.1.3" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-emstreer
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/emstreeR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/emstreeR/emstreeR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 9f1ac4f5164fc5b2bf5b5588f786eea2774d73e896e989478408aba86abc968f

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-mlpack
    - r-scatterplot3d
    - r-sf
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-mlpack
    - r-scatterplot3d
    - r-sf

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('emstreeR')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('emstreeR')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=emstreeR
  dev_url: https://github.com/allanvc/emstreeR
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  summary: Fast and easily computes an Euclidean Minimum Spanning Tree (EMST) from data, relying on the R API for 'mlpack' - the C++ Machine Learning Library (Curtin et. al., 2013). 'emstreeR' uses the Dual-Tree Boruvka (March, Ram, Gray, 2010, <doi:10.1145/1835804.1835882>), which is theoretically and empirically the fastest
    algorithm for computing an EMST. This package also provides functions and an S3 method for readily plotting Minimum Spanning Trees (MST) using either the style of the 'base', 'scatterplot3d', or 'ggplot2' libraries.
  license_family: BSD
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/BSD_3_clause'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - marie59
